creator: Apart ICT
descriptionHtml:
A referee must stay focused at the game. Timekeeping must be done in a good way and whistle can help with this by supporting the referee.

A match consists of 1 or more periods. The duration and optional pause time can be set for each period. The referee will not only be helped with correct time keeping, but whistle will also alert the referee by means of vibration and / or sound.

Whistle can also keep track of the score and possible issued cards. Cards can be linked to a time penalty for a player, so that whistle indicates at the right time that the time has elapsed and the player can participate again.

Finally, at the end of the match, whistle gives an overview of the match with the registration of goals, cards, times and periods.

Whistle is made with field hockey in mind, but can also be used with other sports. For example indoor hockey, soccer and other types of team sports for which time needs to be kept per period.

Voor IOS is er een variant voor iPhone en iPad. Hiermee is het mogelijk om een wedstrijd door de scheidsrechter te laten delen middels een wedstrijdcode. Anderen kunnen deze wedstrijdcode in hun Fluitje App invoeren en dan volgen wat de scheidsrechter doet. Op het moment dat een scheidsrechter de score veranderd of het spel pauzeert, dan zien alle gekoppelde apparaten dat vrijwel direct.
Voor IOS is er een variant voor iPhone en iPad. Hiermee is het mogelijk om een wedstrijd door de scheidsrechter te laten delen middels een wedstrijdcode. Anderen kunnen deze wedstrijdcode in hun Fluitje App invoeren en dan volgen wat de scheidsrechter doet. Op het moment dat een scheidsrechter de score veranderd of het spel pauzeert, dan zien alle gekoppelde apparaten dat vrijwel direct.

Of this Whistle App is a variant available of Android for watch, phone and TV. For IOS there is a variant for iPhone and iPad. With this it becomes possible for the referee to share the match using a match code. Others can enter this match code in their Whistle App and then follow what the referee is doing. When a referee changes the score or pauses the match, all linked devices will see that nearly instantly.

WearOS: this app is made for WearOS devices and works standalone.

Functions in short:
1. On the main screen whistle shows:
a. The current time
b. The current period number
c. The score of the match
d. Counting down time per period
e. The duration of the match
f. The duration of the injury time
2. During the match it can be paused, during the pause the remaining period duration stops counting down, including the remaining penalty time for issued cards
3. During the match the injury time can be enabled, during the injury time the remaining period duration stops counting down, including the remaining penalty time for issued cards
4. When the time is counting down and the device is unused for a while, the battery save mode will be switched on while the app continues to count down
5. Setting up periods for the match (minimum 1, maximum 10)
6. Per period the following can be setup:
a. The duration of the period
b. The duration of the pause after the period
c. If whistle has to give a warning just before the end of the period
d. The time how far from the end of the period the warning has to be given
e. If whistle has to give a warning at the end of the period
7. Management of cards
a. Before a match starts, cards can be setup
i. Color
ii. Name
iii. Possible duration of the time penalty
b. Issueing of cards:
i. Choose the Type of the card
ii. For the away or home team
iii. Optionally the name or number of the player
c. Whistle counts the possible time penalty down and gives a warning at the end
8. At the end of the match whistle provides an overview of the match:
a. The score
b. The details of the goals
c. The details of the issued cards
d. All time details of the match
descriptionShort: A timing tool to support the hockey or soccer referee

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: Contains fixes for small issues, especially for Wear OS 3.0 on Samsumg Galaxy Watch 4.

title: Whistle

creator: Apart ICT
descriptionHtml:
A referee must stay focused at the game. Timekeeping must be done in a good way and Whistle can help with this by supporting the referee.

A match consists of 1 or more periods, for example 2 halves or 4 quarters. For each period the duration and optional pause (rest) time can be set. Whistle can also alert the referee by means of vibration and / or sound when nearing the end or at the end of a period.

Whistle can also keep track of the score and possible cards that are issued. In case a card has a penalty time, Whistle will indicate at the right time that the time has elapsed and the player can participate in the match again.

Finally, at the end of the match, Whistle gives an overview of the match with the registration of goals, cards, times and periods.

Whistle is designed with field hockey in mind, but can also be used with other sports. For example indoor hockey, soccer and other types of team sports for which time needs to be kept per period.

There is also a Whistle variant available of Android for watch, phone and TV. There is even a variant for iPhone, iPad and Watch. It becomes possible to share a match using a match code that can be generated by Whistle. Others can enter this match code in their Whistle variant to follow the shared match (time, score, cards, etc). When a referee changes the score or pauses the match, all linked devices will see that nearly instantly.

WearOS: this app is made for WearOS devices and works standalone.

Functions in short:
1. On the main screen Whistle shows:
a. The current time
b. The current period number
c. The score of the match
d. Counting down (or up) time per period
e. The duration of the match
f. The duration of the injury time
2. During the match it can be paused, during the pause the remaining period duration stops counting down, including the remaining penalty time for issued cards
3. During the match the injury time can be enabled, during the injury time the remaining period duration stops counting down, including the remaining penalty time for issued cards
4. When the time is counting down and the device is unused for a while, the battery save mode will be switched on while the app continues to count down
5. Setting up periods for the match (minimum 1, maximum 10)
6. Per period the following can be setup:
a. The duration of the period
b. The duration of the pause after the period
c. If whistle has to give a warning just before the end of the period
d. The time how far from the end of the period the warning has to be given
e. If whistle has to give a warning at the end of the period
7. Management of cards
a. Before a match starts, cards can be setup
- Color
- Name
- Possible duration of the time penalty
b. Issueing of cards:
- Choose the Type of the card
- For the away or home team
- Optionally the name or number of the player
c. Whistle counts the possible time penalty down and gives a warning at the end
8. Share match or link to another
a. the referee can share his/her match by generating and sharing a match code
b. others can link to a match code to follow that match
9. At the end of the match whistle provides an overview of the match:
a. The score
b. The details of the goals
c. The details of the issued cards
d. All time details of the match

Tips:
1. swipe from bottom to top for the action-menu or press the button of the watch or tap twice on the icon, time or score to perform the desired action.
2. when the pause (rest) time needs to be stopped immediately, press long on the pause action in the action menu or press long on the watch button or tap twice on the rest icon
descriptionShort: A timing tool to support the hockey or soccer referee

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
New features:
- Possibility to count the period time up
- By tapping twice on period time it will count up or down
- By tapping twice on match icon it will execute that action
- By tapping twice on the score a goal will be added

Improvements:
- Start quicker when no network is available
- Color red is made more bright, for better visibility

Bugfixes:
- Prevent a crash when network is unavailable at startup

A match consists of 1 or more periods, for example 2 halves or 4 quarters. For each period the duration and optional pause (rest) time can be set. Whistle can also alert the referee by means of vibration and / or sound when nearing the end or at the end of a period.

Whistle can also keep track of the score and possible cards that are issued. In case a card has a penalty time, Whistle will indicate at the right time that the time has elapsed and the player can participate in the match again.

Finally, at the end of the match, Whistle gives an overview of the match with the registration of goals, cards, times and periods.

Whistle is designed with field hockey in mind, but can also be used with other sports. For example indoor hockey, soccer and other types of team sports for which time needs to be kept per period.

There is also a Whistle variant available of Android for watch, phone and TV. There is even a variant for iPhone, iPad and Watch. It becomes possible to share a match using a match code that can be generated by Whistle. Others can enter this match code in their Whistle variant to follow the shared match (time, score, cards, etc). When a referee changes the score or pauses the match, all linked devices will see that nearly instantly.

WearOS: this app is made for WearOS devices and works standalone.

Functions in short:
1. On the main screen Whistle shows:
a. The current time
b. The current period number
c. The score of the match
d. Counting down (or up) time per period
e. The duration of the match
f. The duration of the injury time
2. During the match it can be paused, during the pause the remaining period duration stops counting down, including the remaining penalty time for issued cards
3. During the match the injury time can be enabled, during the injury time the remaining period duration stops counting down, including the remaining penalty time for issued cards
4. When the time is counting down and the device is unused for a while, the battery save mode will be switched on while the app continues to count down
5. Setting up periods for the match (minimum 1, maximum 10)
6. Per period the following can be setup:
a. The duration of the period
b. The duration of the pause after the period
c. If whistle has to give a warning just before the end of the period
d. The time how far from the end of the period the warning has to be given
e. If whistle has to give a warning at the end of the period
7. Management of cards
a. Before a match starts, cards can be setup
- Color
- Name
- Possible duration of the time penalty
b. Issueing of cards:
- Choose the Type of the card
- For the away or home team
- Optionally the name or number of the player
c. Whistle counts the possible time penalty down and gives a warning at the end
8. Share match or link to another
a. the referee can share his/her match by generating and sharing a match code
b. others can link to a match code to follow that match
9. At the end of the match whistle provides an overview of the match:
a. The score
b. The details of the goals
c. The details of the issued cards
d. All time details of the match

Tips:
1. swipe from bottom to top for the action-menu or press the button of the watch or tap twice on the icon, time or score to perform the desired action.
2. when the pause (rest) time needs to be stopped immediately, press long on the pause action in the action menu or press long on the watch button or tap twice on the rest icon
descriptionShort: A timing tool to support the hockey or soccer referee

title: Whistle

creator: Apart ICT
descriptionHtml:
The ideal tool for the referee for football, hockey, handbal, handball, basketball, rugby or any sport where time per period (or half) must be kept.

What makes Whistle unique in this?
- adjustable for each sport that requires to track time per period / half
- the time of a half or period can be configured, including the duration of the pause / break
- a warning can be given towards the end of a period (adjustable)
- some sports have cards, they can be configured manually
- cards can also have a time penalty and the App keeps track of this and gives a signal when the penalty time is over
- all match settings can be saved as a template, so that for example with a regular soccer match (2 x 45 minutes) and youth soccer (4 x 15 minutes) can be selected quickly
- the App comes standard with 9 templates of different sports to choose from
- at the end of each match, the App provides a clear overview of all match events, such as duration, cards, goals, breaks, etc.
- the match can be shared with other referees, players, team officials or spectators

Ideal for use by a referee on a watch on the wrist. By sharing the match, a fellow referee can also see all the events on his or her watch (or mobile phone).

There is also a variant of the App for watch, telephone and TV. This makes it possible to share a match using a matchcode that can be generated in the App. Others can enter this matchcode in their version of the App (or scan a QR Code) to follow the shared match (time, score, cards, etc.). The moment a referee changes the score or pauses the game, all connected devices see this almost immediately this change.

Tips:
1. tap the icon, time or score twice to perform the desired action.
2. if the pause time needs to be stopped immediately, long press the pause action in the action menu or tap the rest icon 2x
descriptionShort: Whistle tool for the soccer, hockey, rugby or basketball referee

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
For all version of the App:
- many improvements to make network traffic more efficient when sharing matches
- added a time synchronisation with a network time server
- fixed the issue where large matches couldn't be shared anymore
- handed cards will be shown immediately in linked matches
- moved some App settings to the template
- improved user friendlyness
- squashed a few bugs

The TV App can now also display cards.

There is a version of the App for Wear OS watch, Android phone and Google TV. This makes it possible to share a match using a matchcode that can be generated in the App. A link can be shared with others directly from the App, so they can link to the match with their App (or scan a QR Code) and follow the shared match (time, score, cards, etc.). The moment a referee changes the score or pauses the match, all connected devices see this change almost immediately.

Tips:
1. tap the icon, time or score twice to perform the desired action.
2. if the pause time needs to be stopped immediately, long press the pause action in the action menu or tap the rest icon 2x
descriptionShort: Whistle tool for the soccer, hockey, rugby or basketball referee

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: It is now possible to link directly to a match by sharing the correct URL (via WhatsApp or another messaging App). As a result, the user no longer has to type in the matchcode or scan a QR Code, tapping the URL (if the App has already been installed) is then sufficient.
